reviews.review_msg: The course could have been much better if the prof actually lectured on the material and break down the concepts. Instead, he decides to make these note packages, 20 pages long, that you have to memorize each week. Honestly just dissatisfied with how the course is ran.

One of the most interesting courses of the major taught by one of the worst profs in BPK. Marigold does not even teach at lectures and proceeds mostly with integration. Lectures are 2 hours and you should at least go over the 20 pages of plain complex notes you gave us.
This class is absolutely horrendous. Marigold should redesign the course bc the way it is set up is the absolute worse.

Marigold is horrible at teaching the contents in this course. Nvm he doesnt teach at all. You are probably going to be self learning the course material the whole semester lol. Reading and memorizing 20 pages of notes for each chapter. Do not take this course with him.

Marigold isn't any better than Cooke. Better to take this course with a sessional prof if u can. Reading and memorizing 20 pages of notes by yourself is not fun. Marigold does not lecture on any of the materials, only lectures to provide better understanding of some topics/ experiments. Expects answers to be 100 percent the same as the notes.
this guy clearly doesn't know how people learn, makes his lecture notes 20 page essays and expects people to filter out almost 90% of it for the tests,

The way this course is formatted by Marigold is absurd. He does not lecture on any of the material at all and tries to "integrate" the material in the notes to real life applications. Most of the time spent is reading through his 20 pages of notes and memorizing it each week. He grades harshly expecting the students to have the perfect answer.

His notes are literally 20-page transcripts of what he should be saying in class. Instead of simplifying complex topics to make them more digestible, he overcomplicates them. And he won't even go over all of the material in lecture, telling us to read over it ourselves instead. Very disappointed as I was actually excited to take this class

There isn't enough characters to express my distaste for this professor and his ability to teach. It does not matter how much you study for his exams because the depth required is insurmountable. Not to mention there is no true grading scheme, he just assigns points as he pleases without ANY explanation at all. Also lectures don't cover course mat

Daniel is nice and was passionate about the material but his exams were some of the most unfair I have experienced. If you understand the material well that is not enough to do well in this course. Even if you write a perfect final where everything is correct and you go in depth, there isn't a real grading scheme so you'll lose marks without reason
Does not record lectures so you have to attend, the first quiz was difficult. Initially, MT was difficult to write because the material you could go over is so broad. Office hours are very useful

hard to know what he's looking for in midterms and tests... didn't allow recorded lectures so you have to go to class and take notes. make sure you remember all details and be able to link multiple concepts together
super hard mt and final. expects you to memorize all tiny details. AVOID. tutorial lab assignments are long, lectures can be boring

Very intelligent prof and is amazing at explaining things and ensuring that the class is with him. Emphasises experiments that go along with the concepts that he teaches and you will have to memorise all the experiments (at least one) related to that particular concept in order to explain it on the exam. Very clear marker, outlines what he wants.

Initially great. But then 1) didn't mark most of our work, left it to a TA, didn't tell us what we did wrong, 2) was always weirdly condescending answering q's, 3) biggest: his entire course could be taught in a week if not for him explaining a crazy number of totally useless experiments that we needed to rote memorize. Concepts > experiments man.
His midterm was very difficult and most of the class did not have enough time to finish. He is a hard marker and is very specific. His final was also very hard.

Good lecturer, but a very tricky fellow. He loves to have exam questions that are a level of understanding beyond what you'd normally see; one question had turkeys chasing students in a mall, asking what sort of constraints are involved. I highly recommend going to his office hours, both to ask questions and listen to the questions of others.

Great professor, but he expects a lot from you if you want a good grade. Takes a while to get used to his teaching style but gets easier throughout the semester. If you want a fair professor, he's your guy.

AMAZING. INSPIRING. CAPTIVATING. PASSION IS CONTAGIOUS. SOOOOOOOOOOOO FUNNY. MAKES US SMILE AND LAUGH. HIS CLASS MAKES MY DAY. COOLEST PROF EVER OK (he has bad handwriting and can't spell but that's ok). Also you gotta go to lectures, not just because he's cool, but also because he talks a lot about exams and gives extra info that is important!
This semester was his trial run of a new teaching style which focuses more on integration rather than lectures. I found it difficult to follow. Required a lot of reading outside of class.
Professor Dan is awesome! He is great at explaining difficult concepts in an easy to understand way.  He is also super funny in class and his TA is super hot. I really enjoyed the class!

One of the best professor's I've had in terms of material mastery and being able to explain topics in a non-contradictory way. The lessons were extremely well planned, interesting and informative. Picky grader, exams focus on the trivial and lied about the final..."just 1 experiment question" but puts 5..."no definitions" but asks for definitions

Awesome teacher. Integrative assignment needs to be worth more; so much work compared to the lab assignment. Very interesting, but weight doesn't reflect the time you put in to it. Very picky marker, but fair.

Good speaker.  No textbook required, which is great.  Tells you a lot of what's going to be on the exam.  But you really need to prepare for hypothetical questions.  Don't go into the test just memorizing everything.  Go to his office hours, ask him if you're on the right track with things.

Now this guy can teach. Best KIN prof I've had so far. Tells you 'exactly' what's going to be on the test, so you don't waste time reading other useless info. PS. no textbook need only his lecture notes :)
Has an excellent knowledge of the course. Available for help, exams are fair. No need for a textbook. Tells tidbits of information that is funny. Overall I'd give him an A
Great Professor... gives lots of hints on what will be on the exams... no textbook a plus.

BEST PROF I've had at SFU. Attend every lecture, tells you exactly what will be on the tests. Memorize the lecture notes and you'll be fine. He knows his stuff and makes lectures interesting with everday life examples. Funny too and looks like one of the students. Plays games in class!
Funny lame jokes + fair tests + no textbook = great class.

Great Prof! Midterms are pure memorization. Really great guy too, the class struggled on the first midterm and he took a lecture to go over every question in detail. Overal, much better than the past profs who taught this course.
No Comments
Great and interesting class. Prof knows his stuff. No textbook which is always a plus. Lots of memorization but he does demonstrations to help you out.
